[docs]    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)



[docs]    def health_check(self):
        # Determine if it's a OpenBMC TiogaPass
        is_openbmctiogapass = self.detect_openbmc_model("Tioga Pass")
        if not is_openbmctiogapass:
            raise Exception("No OpenBMC Server Tioga Pass device detected")
        else:
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Detected server Tioga Pass")



[docs]    def get_critical_services(self):
        '''
        This method returns a list of services that are always expected to
        run on the openBMC Tiogapass System
        '''
        return ['sensord', 'healthd', 'fscd']



[docs]    def get_slot_info(self):
        return "mb"



[docs]    def get_fru_no(self):
        # TP server FRU is always 1
        return "1"



[docs]    def openbmc_flashcp_upgrade_cmd(self, subfile):
        cmd = "/usr/sbin/"
        cmd += "flashcp -v /tmp/%s /dev/mtd5" % subfile
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def fw_update_bmc(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --bmc %s" % (
            self.get_slot_info(), file_path
        )
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        if reboot:
            self.reboot()
        return out


    # Function can be used if need be in future
    # We do not stress test with rom option currently will be read only

[docs]    def fw_update_rom(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --rom %s" % (
            self.get_slot_info(), file_path
        )
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        if reboot:
            self.reboot()
        return out



[docs]    def validate_version(self, fw_ver_num):
        # validate the version to be updated is 1.5 or higher
        # Use fw-util command accordingly
        match = map(float, re.findall(r"\d+\.\d+", fw_ver_num))
        for match_string in match:
            if match_string >= 1.5:
                return True
            else:
                return False
        else:
            raise Exception(
                "Failed to validate OpenBMC FW version." +
                "Expected 1.5 or higher, got %s" % fw_ver_num
            )

        return

        #cmd = "/usr/local/bin/bios-util mb --boot_order enable --clear_CMOS"
        #self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).clear_boot_order_cmos("mb")
        self.cycle()

[docs]    def nic_fru_list(self):
        AutovalUtils.log_info("fruid-util nic")
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/fruid-util nic"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def get_full_fruid_list(self):
        base = super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).get_full_fruid_list()
        base += "\n" + self.nic_fru_list()
        return base


[docs]    def get_fw_util_options(self):
        base = super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).fw_util_all()
        return base



[docs]    def ac_cycle(self, timeout=120, post_health_check=True):
        '''
        This raw command is sled cycle which tends to lose
        connection to oob, Not appropriate for test cases where bmc
        needs to be intact
        '''
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        raw = "0x06 0x05 0x73 0x6c 0x65 0x64 0x2d 0x63 0x79 0x63 0x6c 0x65"
        cycle_cmd_12v = "ipmitool raw " + raw
        try:
            self.bmc_host.run(cycle_cmd_12v, timeout=timeout)
        except Exception as e:
            if not ('timed out' in str(e).lower()):
                raise Exception("Ac-cycle Failed- %s" % e)

        # First make sure the system is up and runing using dut_health_check
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        self.post_cycle_check()



[docs]    def ac_on_off_fullcycle(self):
        '''
        12V cycles(12V-on/off/cycle) is not
        supported in tiogapass
        '''
        return



[docs]    def bios_post_flash(self, current_reboot):
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        if not self.check_powered_on():
            self.power_on()



[docs]    def sled_cycle(self, timeout=1200, post_health_check=True):
        super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).sled_cycle(
            timeout=timeout, post_health_check=post_health_check
        )
        self.post_cycle_check()



[docs]    def cycle(self, timeout=1200, reboot_check=True, post_health_check=True):
        super(OpenBMCTiogaPass, self).cycle(
            timeout=timeout,
            reboot_check=reboot_check,
            post_health_check=post_health_check
        )
        self.post_cycle_check()



[docs]    def post_cycle_check(self, filter_errors=None):
        self.validate_vboot_util(filter_errors)



[docs]    def verify_flash_sensors(self, out):
        '''
        The ava sensors which shows ok status implies
        the ava is available on the server and in turn
        shows the nvme temp status as ok
        which ever shows NA would mean ava card is not
        available
        '''
        out = out.splitlines()
        for line in out:
            pattern = r'MB_C(\d+)'
            match = re.search(pattern, line)
            if match:
                status = re.search(r'\(ok\)', line)
                if status:
                    continue
                else:
                    out.remove(line)
        out = ''.join(out)
        return out



[docs]    def get_gpio_lbg_tool_path(self):
        tool_path = SiteUtils().get_tool_path()
        gpio_lbg_x64 = os.path.join(tool_path, "gpio_LBG_x64")
        return gpio_lbg_x64



[docs]    def get_bmcreset_cmd(self):
        try:
            cmd = "stat /usr/local/bin/gpio_LBG_x64"
            self.host.run(cmd)
        except Exception:
            gpio_lbg_x64 = self.get_gpio_lbg_tool_path()
            utils.copy_file(
                self.host, gpio_lbg_x64,
                "/usr/local/bin/gpio_LBG_x64"
            )
            cmd = "/bin/chmod +x /usr/local/bin/gpio_LBG_x64"
            self.host.run(cmd)
        cmd = "gpio_LBG_x64 set 1 36 output low && gpio_LBG_x64 set 1 36 output high"
        return (cmd)



[docs]    def verify_flash_availability(self):
        '''
        AVA card is a riser card which holds the nvme.
        To check if the AVA card is present it should provide
        sensor util with ok status or with its temperature.
        This method will check for AVA card and then fetch
        its slot number in order to map the nvme it is holding
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/sensor-util all "
        cmd += "| grep -i AVA"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        ava_slots = []
        try:
            check_ava_present = out.splitlines()
            check_ava_present = filter(lambda x: "ok" in x, check_ava_present)
            for line in check_ava_present:
                pattern = r'MB_C(\d+)_AVA_FTEMP'
                match = re.search(pattern, line)
                if match:
                    flash_slot_number = int(match.group(1))
                    ava_slots.append(flash_slot_number)
            return ava_slots
        except Exception:
            AutovalUtils.log_info("AVA Card is not Available")



[docs]    def get_flash_temperature(self, output, temp_val):
        '''
        This method will take the slot number reported by the
        AVA card, map it to its equivalent nvme and provide
        the temperature of the nvme. Each AVA card will have
        4 slots, max of 4 nvme can be attached.
        At any time if the temperature of the nvme is greater
        then 75 deg celsius it is high threshold value
        '''
        check_temp = collections.defaultdict(list)
        temp_val = 75
        for i in output:
            for index_no in range(4):
                cmd = "/usr/local/bin/sensor-util all "
                cmd += "| grep -i MB_C%d_%d_NVME" % (i, index_no)
                out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
                if "ok" in out:
                    pattern = r'.*\s(\d+\.\d+)\sC'
                    match = re.search(pattern, out)
                    if match:
                        nvme_temp = match.group(1)
                        AutovalUtils.log_info("Temperature of NVME slot%d index%d is %s"
                            % (i, index_no, nvme_temp))
                        check_temp[i].append(nvme_temp)
                else:
                    AutovalUtils.log_info("AVA slot%d with index %d does not have nvme"
                            % (i, index_no))
        threshold = [v for v in check_temp.values()
                    for i in (float(i) for i in v) if i >= temp_val]
        if threshold:
            raise Exception("Temperature %s is higher threshold for NVME" % (threshold))
        return check_temp
